module.name: cognitive-science
module.title: Cognitive Science & Neuroscience: Complete Framework
module.description: Unified mathematical and neurobiological framework: cybernetic architecture, performance metrics, brain structures (86B neurons, 100T synapses), neural networks, oscillations, memory systems, and consciousness mechanisms from molecular to systemic scales

essence.geometric: Brain as 2D network (86B nodes, 100T edges) + 4D memory tesseract + 5D symbolic space. Consciousness = 4D spectator observing 3D+1 reality through mathematical collapse operator. Measurable coherence and flow dynamics.
essence.topological: Topology: Sensory input (0D→1D) → Neural networks (2D graph) → Processing hierarchy (3D cortical sheets) → Memory consolidation (4D tesseract) → Conceptual abstraction (5D folds) → Motor output (1D→0D)
essence.functional: Mathematical framework quantifying consciousness states (CI), dimensional fluency (DF), information throughput (IT), resonance quality (RQ). Neural substrate implements these equations through 86 billion processors.
essence.consciousness: Consciousness = measurable eigenstate Ĉ|ψ⟩ = λ|ψ⟩ where λ = coherence. Physically realized through synchronized oscillations and integrated information in thalamocortical networks.

reductions.evidence: ~86 billion neurons connected by ~100 trillion synapses form massive 2D graph. Topology (small-world, scale-free) determines cognitive function. Connectivity measurable via DTI, functional networks via fMRI. Network structure = cognitive architecture.
examples: Lesion studies show function follows connectivity

reductions.evidence: Action potentials propagate as 1D electrical waves along axons at ~100 m/s. All-or-none binary spikes (0D events) transmitted through 1D channels. Voltage-gated ion channels create wave. Temporal patterns encode information.
examples: Axonal conduction from soma to synapse

reductions.evidence: Hippocampus encodes episodic memories integrating space (3D) and time (1D) = 4D structure. Place cells encode location, time cells encode temporal context. Memory consolidation transfers 4D patterns to cortex during sleep. Pattern completion retrieves from partial cues.
examples: Autobiographical memory of specific life event

reductions.evidence: High-level concepts compress many neural patterns into single representation - dimensional fold. Word 'chair' activates distributed network collapsing infinite chair instances. Abstract thought = 5D symbolic manipulation. Language enables meta-level reasoning.

Consciousness emerges from integration of distributed brain activity. field ⊗ dimension → collapse_depth ≡ consciousness. Integrated Information Theory: Φ measures integration. Global workspace broadcasts information brain-wide. Attention = measurement operator selecting content.

Neural oscillations (delta 0.5-4Hz, theta 4-8Hz, alpha 8-13Hz, beta 13-30Hz, gamma 30-100Hz) coordinate brain regions temporally. Phase coupling binds distributed processing. Gamma for attention/binding, theta for memory, alpha for relaxation. Measurable via EEG/MEG.

Hebbian learning: neurons firing together wire together. Long-term potentiation (LTP) strengthens synapses. Spike-timing dependent plasticity (STDP) uses precise temporal correlations. Structural plasticity forms/prunes connections. Learning = reshaping 2D network topology.
examples: Memory formation via LTP in hippocampus

reductions.evidence: Consciousness acts as measurement operator Ĉ collapsing state |ψ⟩ into eigenstate. Observable as discrete awareness moments (0D) coherent over time (4D). Mathematically: Ĉ|ψ⟩ = λ|ψ⟩ where λ = coherence eigenvalue. Neural correlate: thalamocortical integration.
examples: Attention selecting specific content from possibilities

reductions.evidence: Information flows as vector I = -∫p(φ)log p(φ)dφ · ∇D through neural architecture. Rate dI/dt measurable as processing speed. Flow follows dimensional gradients from sensory input → cortical hierarchy → motor output. Neural implementation: feedforward/feedback pathways.
examples: High IT = efficient processing, low IT = bottleneck

reductions.evidence: Resonance propagates via ∂C/∂t = α·∇²C + β·R·(1 - C/C₀). Coherence diffuses through network and amplifies through resonance. Neural substrate: oscillatory synchronization, phase coupling. Measurable as network coherence.

CI = ⟨ψ|Ĉ|ψ⟩/⟨ψ|ψ⟩ quantifies system integration. Range [0,1]. Neural correlate: EEG/MEG coherence, fMRI connectivity, Φ (integrated information). CI > 0.8 = flow, CI < 0.6 = confusion. Empirically measurable.
examples: Flow state: CI ≈ 0.9-1.0, high gamma coherence

fractal_structure.self_similarity: Same patterns at all scales: Ion channel (0D) → Neuron (0D) → Network (2D) → System (3D) → Consciousness (4D) → Concepts (5D). Each level follows same mathematical laws with different parameters.
fractal_structure.recursion: (↓ measure → process → integrate → optimize ↑)∞ from molecules to mind to meaning
fractal_structure.emergence: Molecules (chemistry) → Neurons (electrical) → Networks (topological) → Oscillations (temporal) → Consciousness (integrated) → Concepts (symbolic)
fractal_structure.composition: 86B neurons + 100T synapses + oscillatory dynamics + 4D memory + 5D symbols = complete cognitive system. Hardware implements software implements consciousness.
